name: stexls-vscode-client
description: VSCode client for the stex language server

stexls.pythonInterpreter.description: The python executable used to starts the server. The selected interpreter must have the stexls package installed. This setting can be the complete path to the interpreter executable.

stexls.command.description: The command executed by the selected python interpreter. This should start the language server. Go to a terminal and type 'python -m stexls lsp --help' for more information. The 'transport-kind' argument should never be changed.

stexls.compileWorkspace.description: The server will compile every file in the workspace on startup if enabled. This will take advantage of multiprocessing and @stexls.numJobs to speed it up. The server will be able to make diagnostics based on every file and symbol in the workspace.

stexls.lintWorkspaceOnStartup.description: Lint every file in the workspace on startup.

stexls.numJobs.description: Number of processes used for compilation of the workspace.

stexls.delay.description: Delays linting after a change to a file is made. (Value in seconds)

stexls.logfile.description: Path to logfile used by the server.

stexls.loglevel.description: The maximum log level. Setting it to 'error' will only log errors, but 'info' will log 'warning' and 'errors' as well.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
